attributes.action: Lower the custodial threshold for lifetime registration of child sex offenders
attributes.additional_details:
If the this was reduced it would reduce the unseen risk to children & nurture any hope of rehabilitation.
Can sex offenders be rehabilitated? Not according to one leading expert: https://www.itv.com/news/2018-04-03/uks-top-child-protection-officer-says-online-sex-offenders-can-be-rehabilitated-instead-of-jailed/
"There are half a million offenders in the UK viewing & downloading images of child abuse, the NSPCC says. And police are arresting 420 offenders a month, according to Cheif Cons Bailey."
attributes.background: We ask government to review & alter the custodial threshold for the length of time convicted sex offenders have to sign the register. At present a SO given a sentence of 30 months or less only has to stay on it for 5/10 years. We want to see this sentence requirement reducing to 12 months or less.
